Job Title: Deckhand

Location: Oxnard, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Description

At Leidos, we deliver innovative solutions through the efforts of our diverse and talented people who are dedicated to our customersâ€™ success. We empower our teams, contribute to our communities, and operate sustainable. Everything we do is built on a commitment to do the right thing for our customers, our people, and our community. Our Mission, Vision, and Values guide the way we do business.

Are you ready for your next career challenge?

The National Security Sector at Leidos, supporting the Medium/Overlord Unmanned Surface Vessel (O/MUSV) Program, is seeking Deckhands with Entry level USCG Merchant Mariner Credentials and corresponding STCW certificates to support a dynamic high growth organization. The O/MUSV program is based in Port Hueneme, CA, and is responsible for delivering cutting edge autonomous vessel technology to the US Navy. The program operates and maintains prototype autonomous vessels for test and evaluation of the vessels as well as developing operations, maintenance, logistics and training procedures for the autonomous Fleet of the future.

Deckhands work rotating 12 hour shifts, on a 28 day on/28 day off rotation. Duties include preparation, preservation, and cleanliness of navy watercraft, watch standing at sea and in port, and pre/post mission craft readiness functions. Provides basic facility maintenance support and cleaning duties.

Primary Responsibilities

Crew Member (Deckhand) shall be experienced in basic seamanship duties and capable of performing as line handler, watch stander and ship's crew as required.Reports to Master and Ops Coordinator for unmanned O/MUSV ship, working at-sea and/or dockside environments.Assists in preparation, preservation, and cleanliness of unmanned M/OUSV ship, and any associated equipment.Assists in pre/post mission craft readiness functionsProvides basic facility maintenance support and cleaning dutiesMay assist in facility security and visitor control functionYou will participate in Leidos and Government safety programs.This position will require close cooperation and working relationships with active-duty military and other Government personnel.

Required Qualifications

Position requires the ability to perform in an arduous duty environment.High school diploma or equivalent and a minimum of 1 year of relevant experience.Previous experience performing basic seamanship duties.Familiarity with small boat operation, basic small craft maintenance, line handling, and launching/recovering from trailers.Ability to lift 40lbs. Individuals must possess the ability and demeanor to share common spaces over lengthy deployment periods and work closely with others in a small working area and in a shipboard environment.Must be able to communicate effectively in English.Us citizen with ability to obtain a Secret level DoD Security clearance.USCG Entry Level MMC or greater STCW RFPNW

Preferred Qualifications

Active Secret level DoD Security clearance.Prior US service afloat on US Government vessels
